subject: Re: [junit] How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: ... It is certainly possible to test private methods, but I prefer not to do it. I prefer to make the method public, test it, then figure out why it was
messageBody:
Praveen AH wrote:

> It is not possible to test private methods in a class i believe but i am
> not sure in this. because generally client could able to access only
> public methods not the private methods.

It is certainly possible to test private methods, but I prefer not to do
it. I prefer to make the method public, test it, then figure out why it
was private in the first place.

It is worth noting that I never write private methods; they only come
into being when I extract methods. I routinely make methods public as
needed and it doesn't cause me any pain.
--
